query:
個客想改保單上的性別，需要交什麽文件
The client wants to change the gender on the insurance policy. What documents are required?

results.title_name_tc: 表格 - 保誠理財顧問
results.content_en:
我們會不時更新我們的私隱通知,並建議閣下瀏覽本公司網站以了解該私隱通知。該私隱通知可在本公司網站
[https://www.prudential.com.hk/scws/pages/tc/privacy-policy/index.html〕 上查閱。閣下填妥並繼續提交本表格,即表示閣下確認已閱讀並理解
本收集個人資料聲明。
業務合作夥伴指我們的服務供應商、提供行政、電信、電腦、信息技術、數據處理及儲存、客戶滿意度分析、支付、印刷、贖回或其
他服務予我們,以使我們能夠經營我們業務,會計師、審計師、IT服務和平台供應商、保險中介機構、再保險承保人、投資經理、代理、
退休金受託人(和其他持分者)、計劃顧問、介紹人、核准的第三方金融和保險產品供應商以及我們的法律顧問。
營銷合作夥伴指我們的服務供應商提供行政、電信、電腦、支付、印刷、第三方獎賞/會員/優惠計劃、醫療/健康/保健相關產品、
贖回或其他服務,以使我們能夠經營我們業務、保險中介、退休金受託人(和其他持分者)、計劃顧問、介紹人和核准的第三方金融
和保險產品供應商。
LAPA/DATCLN (01/24)
11/13
DATCLN0411Part 10 第十部分 Signature 簽署
I/ We, the undersigned, confirm my/our understanding, consent and agreement to the contents of this application form and hereby make the
application for changing the life assured of the policy as stated above. 本人/吾等,簽署確認明白及同意此申請表之內容,並特此就上述之
保單作出更換受保人之申請。
If the signatory is a Company / Partnership / Sole Proprietorship, its authorized signatories should sign and chop. 如簽署方為公司 /合夥/獨資
經營持有,須由公司授權人員簽署及蓋章。
/
/
Day
Month
Year
Signature of Current Policyowner
Signature of Current Life Assured (whose attained age must be
日
月
年
現有保單持有人簽署
(It must be consistent with that in our record
保單持有人的簽署必須與本公司的記錄
相符)
18 or above)
現有保單受保人簽署
(必須年滿18歲或以上的受保人)
(if current Policyowner is not the current Life Assured
只適用於當現有保單持有人及現有保單受保人非同一人)
Signature of Proposed New Life Assured
(whose attained age is 18 or above)
擬定之新保單受保人簽署
(適用於18歲或以上的受保人)
Signature of Collateral Assignee (if applicable)
抵押轉讓之承讓人簽署(如適用)
The witness must be an individual third party aged 18 or above. If the Policyowner uses signature chop or fingerprint, two witnesses are
required. The personal particulars of the witness(es) will only be used for the purpose of verification and confirmation of the identity(ies) of the
signatory(ies) of this form. 見證人必須為年滿18歲或以上的第三者。若保單持有人以圖章蓋印或指紋簽署,必須有兩位見證人。見證人
之個人資料只會用於處理本申請及確認此表格簽署人的身份之用。
Signature of Witness
見證人簽署
Name and Identity Document
Number of Witness
見證人姓名及身份證明文件
號碼
Signature of Witness
見證人簽署
Name and Identity Document
Number of Witness
見證人姓名及身份證明文件
號碼
Please DO NOT sign on BLANK form. 請勿在空白表格上簽署。
Important Notes: In order to speed up your application, please attach the required documents together with this registration form. You may
check the required documents as stated in the below "Document Checklist". Please check the boxes below to indicate that the document has been
attached and met all the requirements as set out below.
重要事項:為使能儘速辦理閣下的申請,請將此表格連同有關文件一併遞交。有關所需遞交的文件,閣下可參閱以下的「文件檢核
表」。檢查後,請於方格內加上「√」號以示確認遞交有關文件及符合以下所有要求。
12/13
LAPA/DATCLN (01/24)
DATCLN0412

DATCLN0412Document Checklist 文件檢核表
Document Type 文件類別
Important Notes 注意事項(Copy MUST be clear 副本必須清晰)
1.
Identity Document Type 身份證明文件類別:
Copy of Birth Cert 出生證明書副本
The latest & valid supporting documents of the existing policyowner's
and the proposed new life insured's
現有保單持有人及擬定之新受保人的最新及有效證明文件
Copy of Identity document / Passport / Mainland Identity Card /
Chinese Travel Permit
身份證明文件/護照/中國居民身份證副本/
往來港澳通行證
Inspect/submit the age proof of proposed new life assured in order to
ensure correct
age for assessment
檢查/提交擬定之新受保人的年齡證明,以確保正確的評估年齡
2.
Proof of Relationship between current policyowner and proposed new
life assured 現有保單持有人與擬定之新受保人關係證明
There must be insurable interest between current policyowner and the
proposed new life assured. 現有保單持有人與擬定之新受保人之間
必須具有可保利益關係。
Provide Document proof of the relationship between the employer and the
employee
提供僱主及僱員的關係證明的文件授權訂立保險合同及賦權
有關人士操作戶口的委託書,及簽名式樣
Individual 個人
Copy of Birth Cert / Marriage Cert / other doc to prove relationship
proof
出生證明書副本/結婚證書副本/其他文件副本的關係證明
的文件
Employee Benefit (Corporate) 員工福利(團體)
Board resolution to enter into insurance contracts / other
written document to authorize the person act on behalf of the
customer to operate the insurance policy
授權訂立保險合同及賦權關人士操作戶口的委託書,
及簽名式樣
MPF Record Certificate 強積金紀錄證明書
Provide the MPF record certificate and the contribution records for
the past 1 month
提供強積金紀錄證明書及最近一個月的供款紀錄
3.
Additional document for "Replacement of Deceased Life Assured"
「替換已故受保人」之附加文件:
Copy of Death Certificate of Deceased Life Assured
已故受保人之死亡證副本
Applicable to Evergreen Wealth Multi-Currency Plan only
只適用於雋富多元貨幣計劃

DATTPM0109Part X 第十部 Policy Replacement Declaration 轉保聲明
In order to subsidize the purchase of your new life insurance policy, are you using, or do you intend to use the funds arising from the existing life insurance
policy (or multiple life insurance policies) (collectively "existing life insurance policy(ies)") that you have or had, or any savings made by reducing the premium
payable under your existing life insurance policy in the past or next 12 months, by means of the followings:
閣下是否打算在未來緊接的十二個月內,或已經在過去的十二個月內,使用或打算使用 閣下現時或曾經持有的一張或多張人壽保單
(下稱“現有人壽保單”)透過下列方式取得資金或節省保費,以資助購買新人壽保單所需的費用?
1. Reducing the total cash value, sum assured, other policy value(s) or policy right(s) of the existing life insurance policy(ies), by exercising the policy right
under the existing life insurance policy(ies) (including wholly or partially withdrawal, wholly or partially surrender);
2. Taking out a policy loan from the existing life insurance policy (ies);
3. Reducing, suspending or non-payment of premium under the existing life insurance policy(ies), including switching to reduced paid-up or extended term
insurance by automatic operation of the terms and conditions, exercising automatic premium loan, premium holiday or lapsation, etc .; or
4. Transferring or assigning ownership of existing life insurance policy(ies).
1. 行使現有人壽保單內之權利,包括提取全部或部份保單款項、退保或部份退保等,以減少現有人壽保單的現金價值總額、保險金額、
其他保單價值或保單權益;
2. 從現有人壽保單中提取保單貸款;
3. 減少、暫停或終止支付現有人壽保單之保費,包括藉保單條款及細則自動運作的情況下使其變為減額清繳保單或展期保單、執行自動
保費貸款、執行保費假期條款或保單失效等;或
4.
更改現有人壽保單的擁有權或將其轉讓。
□
Yes (Please complete the Life Insurance Policy Replacement Declaration, read carefully and sign the Declaration below)
是(請填寫《人壽保險客戶轉保聲明書》並詳閱下列聲明及簽署)
□
No (Please read carefully and sign the Declaration below)
否(請詳閱下列聲明及簽署)
Warning: Please answer the above questions carefully. Making changes or replacing your existing life insurance policy(ies) with your new life
insurance policy (i.e. policy replacement) may not be in your best interest. To protect your interests, you should approach the insurer of your
existing life insurance policy(ies) to obtain up to date information on your existing life insurance policy(ies) and your insurance intermediary
should assist you to evaluate and compare your existing and new life insurance policies. If your above answer is "Yes", your insurance intermediary
must assist you to complete the "Life Insurance Policy Replacement Declaration" and explain to you the implications and disadvantages of
financial, insurability and claims eligibility of such policy replacement.
警告:請 閣下慎重回答以上問題。以新人壽保單變更或取替現有人壽保單(即轉保)未必符合 閣下的最佳利益。為保障 閣下之利益,
閣下應向現有人壽保單的保險公司索取最新資料,而有關保險中介人亦應協助 閣下對現有人壽保單及新人壽保單進行評估及比較。倘
閣下上述回覆為“是”,有關保險中介人必須協助 閣下填寫《人壽保險客戶轉保聲明書》及解釋有關轉保對 閣下的財務、受保資格及
索償資格所帶來之影響及弊端。
Signature of the Applicant/Proposer

或作出任何不實陳述,可導致保險合約無效。
Part 7 % LABS Declaration by the Policyowner/Current Life Assured/New Life Assured/ Collateral Assignee (if applicable)
保單持有人/現有受保人/新受保人/抵押承讓人(如適用)聲明
I / We, the policyowner/ current life assured/ new life assured/ collateral assignee, hereby make this application to change the life assured of the policy
according to the above particulars. We understand and agree that this application form will become a part of the policy once approved by Prudential. We
acknowledge and confirm that we fully understand the implication of making this application and have consented to this request.
本人/吾等,作為保單持有人/現有受保人/新受保人/抵押承讓人,在此要求按照上述細則更換保單受保人。我們明白及同意經保誠
批准後此申請表將構成保單之一部份。我們承認及確認我們完全明白本申請之含義及同意這要求。
Part 8 第八部分 Declaration by the Policyowner 保單持有人聲明
Declaration of Policyowner - for Juvenile Policy (Proposed new Life Assured under Age 18 when applying for Change of Life Assured)
I, the Policyowner, declare and consent to act as the trustee of the policy for the proposed assurance subject to the following terms and conditions: (1) all
benefits payable under the policy for the proposed assurance shall belong to the Proposed new Life Assured who shall be the irrevocable beneficiary and
shall be paid through me until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life Assured; (2) I shall have the right to exercise every
option, benefit and privilege under the policy in my capacity as the trustee until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life
Assured; (3) upon the Proposed new Life Assured attaining age 18, I and the Proposed new Life Assured may jointly apply for transfer of the ownership of
the policy to that Life Assured by completing the required forms and providing all information and such documents as Prudential may require at the time of
such application; and (4) upon the transfer of policy ownership to the Life Assured pursuant to clause (3) above, all my rights, entitlements and powers in
relation to the policy shall automatically cease.
適用於兒童保單(即更換受保人申請時擬定之新受保人未滿18歲)-保單持有人聲明
本人,作為保單持有人,現聲明及同意依據下列條款及條件擔任本保單的信託人:(1)本保單之所有保障利益將屬於擬定之新受保人,
擬定之新受保人為本保單之不可撤銷受益人,而所有本保單之保障利益將由本人代擬定之新受保人託管,直至本保單之持有權轉予擬
定之新受保人;(2)本人可以信託人身分行使本保單之任何選擇權、利益及特權,直至本保單之持有權轉予擬定之新受保人;(3)當擬
定之新受保人年滿18歲後,本人/吾等及擬定之新受保人可共同申請將保單持有權轉予該受保人,並填妥所需表格及提供貴公司在申請
時所需之所有資料及文件;及(4)當保單持有權根據上述第(3)條轉予該受保人後,本人於本保單之所有權利、權益及權力將自動終止。

results.content_en:
Account) 賬戶持有人之英文全名(適用於個人、聯名及公司戶口) |  |
| Account Holder(s) Signature 銀行賬戶持有人簽署 |  |
| It must be consistent with that in your bank's record; For Joint Account, please provide all the signatures required by the Joint Account Mandate; For corporate customer, please also stamp your company chop 銀行賬戶持有人的簽署必須與銀行記錄上的簽署式樣相同;如屬聯名戶口,請提供聯名戶口 授權要求的所有簽名;如屬公司客戶,請同時蓋上公司蓋章。

| 覆核 | 經辦 |
| --- | --- |
|  |  |Part 1c
第一部分 丙部
Declaration of Relationship between the Account Holder and Policyowner or Life Assured
賬戶持有人與保單持有人或受保人之關係聲明
Prudential shall have the right to reject this form if this part is incomplete. 若閣下未完成此部分,保誠有權拒絕此表格。
Account holder must be the Policyowner / Life Assured. If the account holder is an immediate family member of the Policyowner or Life Assured
(i.e. spouse, parent, children, siblings, or grandparent) or other third parties, the Policyowner MUST complete this part.
賬戶持有人必須為保單持有人或受保人。若賬戶持有人為保單持有人或受保人之直系親屬(即配偶/父母/子女/兄弟姊妹/祖父母)
或其他第三者,則保單持有人必須填寫此部分。
Third Party Payment 第三者付款(Please darken the appropriate box. 請塗黑適當選項。)
Spouse 配偶
Parent 父母
Children 子女
O
Siblings 兄弟姊妹
Grandparent 祖父母
Legal Guardian 合法監護人(Please provide supporting document 請提供證明文件)
Company 100% owned by the Policyowner or Life Assured 保單持有人或受保人完全擁有之公司
(Please provide (i) a copy of Business Registration Certificate or Certificate of Incorporation; and (ii) a copy of latest Annual Return)
(請提供(i)商業登記證或公司註冊證明書之副本;及(ii)最新的周年申報表之副本)
Part 2 第二部分 Change of Payment Mode & Autopay for Other Policies 就其他保單申請更改繳費方式及自動轉賬
1. The following policies must be owned by the same Policyowner as the policy specified on Page 1. 以下保單必須與載於第1頁之保單為同一持有人所
持有。

Part 3 第三部分 Personal Information Collection Statement 收集個人資料聲明
Prudential Hong Kong Limited (Macau Branch) (referred to as "Company", "our", "we", or "us") takes the privacy and protection of your personal information
seriously. We collect personal information from you that is necessary or helpful for us to either provide you with the product or service you have requested or to
comply with statutory or contractual requirements (including the purposes mentioned below), or even for security purpose. We may collect personal information
including, but not limited to, full name, address, contact details, contact details history, date of birth, gender, nationality, family members, beneficiaries, identity
card copy and details, travel document information, health/medical records, credit information, product history, claims history, biometric data including but
not limited to your voice pattern, fingerprint and facial images, your location information based on your device, financial and medical information ("Personal
Information") to provide you with the insurance or financial products or services. "Personal information" shall also include, but not be limited to, the personal
information relating to your beneficiaries (or any other person designated or entitled to receive any benefits under an insurance policy), dependents, authorised
representatives, company staff, and other individuals in relation to which you have provided personal information. If you provide personal information about
another person to us, you confirm that you are either their parent or guardian or you have obtained that person's consent to provide such personal information
for use and transfer by the Company for the purposes set out in this PICS. We may also collect Personal Information about you from third parties such as other
insurance companies, agents, credit reference/reporting agencies, vendors, financial institutions, fraud prevention agencies, government agencies, medical
personnel, courts or public record.
China Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
The PIPL Addendum supplements the Personal Information Collection Statement and applies to you if you are located in Mainland China. The PIPL Addendum is
available on our website at https://www.prudential.com.hk/en/china-personal-information-protection-law .
1. Purpose of Collection
We may use your Personal Information for the following purposes: (a) the administration of our products and services, including to provide any relevant services
as discussed with you prior to any purchase of a product or service; (b) to process your application; (c) to administer and process insurance policies, insurance
claims, medical, security and underwriting checks; (d) to process payment instructions; (e) to verify your eligibility for insurance, financial or wealth management
products and services; (f) to design and provide you with insurance, financial and related products and services; (g) to communicate with you; (h) to comply with
any regulatory or other legal requirements or other internal business requirements (whether imposed on us or any third parties in Section 2 below), including but
not limited to anti-money laundering and Know-Your-Client obligations; (i) to investigate and settle claims and detect and prevent fraud (whether or not relating
to the policy issued in respect of this application) and/or other illegal activity, or security or technical issues; (j) to carry out checks using agencies including credit
reference agencies, tracing companies or publicly available information; (k) to provide customer services; (I) to perform automated decision-making or profiling; (m)
to perform a policy review or needs analysis; (n) to conduct research and statistical analysis (including use of new technologies); (o) to administer lucky draws and
other contests; (p) to enable us to perform our obligations to you; (q) to keep your information on record and carry out other internal business administration;
(r) with your specific consent where required for direct marketing as explained in Section 3 below, personalise and tailor, customised promotions, messages and
suggestions to you; and (s) any other purpose directly relating to any of the above purposes. With your consent, we may also use your personal data to send you
marketing communications, as described in Section 3 below.
Some of the purposes above are necessary to allow us to perform our contractual obligations to you and to enable us to comply with applicable laws and
regulation. We may also use and share your Personal Information for the purposes described above to improve our products and services. Your Personal
Information will be stored either for as long as you (or your joint policyholder) are our customer, or longer if required by law or as is otherwise necessary.
LAPA/PRMMBD (06/24)

Part 3 第三部分 Personal Information Collection Statement 收集個人資料聲明
Prudential Hong Kong Limited (Macau Branch) (referred to as "Company", "our", "we", or "us") takes the privacy and protection of your personal information
seriously. We collect personal information from you that is necessary or helpful for us to either provide you with the product or service you have requested or to
comply with statutory or contractual requirements (including the purposes mentioned below), or even for security purpose. We may collect personal information
including, but not limited to, full name, address, contact details, contact details history, date of birth, gender, nationality, family members, beneficiaries, identity
card copy and details, travel document information, health/medical records, credit information, product history, claims history, biometric data including but
not limited to your voice pattern, fingerprint and facial images, your location information based on your device, financial and medical information ("Personal
Information") to provide you with the insurance or financial products or services. "Personal information" shall also include, but not be limited to, the personal
information relating to your beneficiaries (or any other person designated or entitled to receive any benefits under an insurance policy), dependents, authorised
representatives, company staff, and other individuals in relation to which you have provided personal information. If you provide personal information about
another person to us, you confirm that you are either their parent or guardian or you have obtained that person's consent to provide such personal information
for use and transfer by the Company for the purposes set out in this PICS. We may also collect Personal Information about you from third parties such as other
insurance companies, agents, credit reference/reporting agencies, vendors, financial institutions, fraud prevention agencies, government agencies, medical
personnel, courts or public record.
China Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
The PIPL Addendum supplements the Personal Information Collection Statement and applies to you if you are located in Mainland China. The PIPL Addendum is
available on our website at https://www.prudential.com.hk/en/china-personal-information-protection-law .
1. Purpose of Collection
We may use your Personal Information for the following purposes: (a) the administration of our products and services, including to provide any relevant services
as discussed with you prior to any purchase of a product or service; (b) to process your application; (c) to administer and process insurance policies, insurance
claims, medical, security and underwriting checks; (d) to process payment instructions; (e) to verify your eligibility for insurance, financial or wealth management
products and services; (f) to design and provide you with insurance, financial and related products and services; (g) to communicate with you; (h) to comply with
any regulatory or other legal requirements or other internal business requirements (whether imposed on us or any third parties in Section 2 below), including but
not limited to anti-money laundering and Know-Your-Client obligations; (i) to investigate and settle claims and detect and prevent fraud (whether or not relating
to the policy issued in respect of this application) and/or other illegal activity, or security or technical issues; (j) to carry out checks using agencies including credit
reference agencies, tracing companies or publicly available information; (k) to provide customer services; (I) to perform automated decision-making or profiling; (m)

Part 3 第三部分 Personal Information Collection Statement 收集個人資料聲明
Prudential Hong Kong Limited (Macau Branch) (referred to as "Company", "our", "we", or "us") takes the privacy and protection of your personal information
seriously. We collect personal information from you that is necessary or helpful for us to either provide you with the product or service you have requested or to
comply with statutory or contractual requirements (including the purposes mentioned below), or even for security purpose. We may collect personal information
including, but not limited to, full name, address, contact details, contact details history, date of birth, gender, nationality, family members, beneficiaries, identity
card copy and details, travel document information, health/medical records, credit information, product history, claims history, biometric data including but
not limited to your voice pattern, fingerprint and facial images, your location information based on your device, financial and medical information ("Personal
Information") to provide you with the insurance or financial products or services. "Personal information" shall also include, but not be limited to, the personal
information relating to your beneficiaries (or any other person designated or entitled to receive any benefits under an insurance policy), dependents, authorised
representatives, company staff, and other individuals in relation to which you have provided personal information. If you provide personal information about
another person to us, you confirm that you are either their parent or guardian or you have obtained that person's consent to provide such personal information
for use and transfer by the Company for the purposes set out in this PICS. We may also collect Personal Information about you from third parties such as other
insurance companies, agents, credit reference/reporting agencies, vendors, financial institutions, fraud prevention agencies, government agencies, medical
personnel, courts or public record.
China Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
The PIPL Addendum supplements the Personal Information Collection Statement and applies to you if you are located in Mainland China. The PIPL Addendum is
available on our website at https://www.prudential.com.hk/en/china-personal-information-protection-law .
1. Purpose of Collection
We may use your Personal Information for the following purposes: (a) the administration of our products and services, including to provide any relevant services
as discussed with you prior to any purchase of a product or service; (b) to process your application; (c) to administer and process insurance policies, insurance
claims, medical, security and underwriting checks; (d) to process payment instructions; (e) to verify your eligibility for insurance, financial or wealth management
products and services; (f) to design and provide you with insurance, financial and related products and services; (g) to communicate with you; (h) to comply with
any regulatory or other legal requirements or other internal business requirements (whether imposed on us or any third parties in Section 2 below), including but
not limited to anti-money laundering and Know-Your-Client obligations; (i) to investigate and settle claims and detect and prevent fraud (whether or not relating
to the policy issued in respect of this application) and/or other illegal activity, or security or technical issues; (j) to carry out checks using agencies including credit
reference agencies, tracing companies or publicly available information; (k) to provide customer services; (I) to perform automated decision-making or profiling; (m)
to perform a policy review or needs analysis; (n) to conduct research and statistical analysis (including use of new technologies); (o) to administer lucky draws and
other contests; (p) to enable us to perform our obligations to you; (q) to keep your information on record and carry out other internal business administration;
(r) with your specific consent where required for direct marketing as explained in Section 3 below, personalise and tailor, customised promotions, messages and
suggestions to you; and (s) any other purpose directly relating to any of the above purposes. With your consent, we may also use your personal data to send you
marketing communications, as described in Section 3 below.
Some of the purposes above are necessary to allow us to perform our contractual obligations to you and to enable us to comply with applicable laws and
regulation. We may also use and share your Personal Information for the purposes described above to improve our products and services. Your Personal
Information will be stored either for as long as you (or your joint policyholder) are our customer, or longer if required by law or as is otherwise necessary.
LAPA/PRMMBD (06/24)

handling fee of HK$ 100 shall be charged for each cheque reissuance.
在未有就賠償指定銀行戶口時,將只會向保單持有人發出賠償支票。如有遺失賠償支票,保單持有人請以書面通知本公司。本公司將為每張補發支票收取HK$100行政費。
3. For changing direct debit account premium settlement, please fill in the Payment Details Amendment Form.
如欲更改以自動轉賬繳付保費的銀行戶口號碼,請另填更改付款資料申請表。

A handling fee of HK$ 100 shall be charged for each cheque reissuance. 在未有就賠償指定銀行戶口時,將只會向保單持有人發出賠償支票。如有遺失賠償支票,保單持有人請以書面通知本公司。本公司將為每張補發支票收取HK$100行政費。 3. 定或更改的指定百分比的申請,本公司會發出批註以記錄該指定人士的委任、更改或取消及/或設定或
更改的指定百分比,並於該批註的日期起生效。
14. Financial consultant cannot be appointed as Designated Person, unless he/she is the immediate family member (including spouse, parents, child, siblings,
grandparents, grandchild) of the policyowner. If financial consultant is appointed as Designated Person, independent witness signature is required. IF B7}
顧問如非保單持有人之直系親屬(包括配偶/父母/子女/兄弟姊妹/祖父母/孫兒女),不可被委任成為指定人士。如委任理財
顧問為指定人士,須有獨立見證人簽署。
00000000
3/8
DATIOM0203
LAPA/DATIOM (02/25)Part 1
第一部分
Important Facts for Appointment, Change or Removal of Designated Person (Continued)
委任、更改或取消指定人士委任的重要資料(績)
15. The witness should not be the policyowner himself or the Designated Person. 見證人不可為保單持有人或指定人士。
16. You have the right to appoint, change or remove the Designated Person, and/or designate or change of Designated Percentage by submitting a request
using the latest version of Prudential's prescribed form but you must be mentally sane at the time of such request. 閣下有權使用保誠最新版本的
指定表格要求委任、更改或取消指定人士,及/或設定或更改指定百分比,但閣下在提出該要求時必須神智正常。
17. This form is not an enduring power of attorney and does not appoint the Designated Person as your attorney or guardian or curator. If you wish to
appoint the Designated Person as your attorney to protect your interests, you will need to seek your independent legal advice. Z 1 BTEJF -TE#
授權書,亦非用以委任指定人士為閣下的受權人或監護人或保佐人。若閣下希望委任指定人士為您的受權人以保障您的利益,閣下
需徵詢獨立法律意見。
18. Appointment of Designated Person under Incapacity Option does not change the appointment of beneficiary(ies) under the above policy. 1 3
能力選項委任指定人士並不改變根據上述保單已委任的受益人。
19. You must promptly inform the Designated Person for the relevant arrangement. 閣下必須及時通知指定人士相關之安排。

results.title_name_tc: 表格 - 保誠理財顧問
results.content_en:
我們會不時更新我們的私隱通知,並建議閣下瀏覽本公司網站以了解該私隱通知。該私隱通知可在本公司網站
[https://www.prudential.com.hk/scws/pages/tc/privacy-policy/index.html〕 上查閱。閣下填妥並繼續提交本表格,即表示閣下確認已閱讀並理解
本收集個人資料聲明。
業務合作夥伴指我們的服務供應商、提供行政、電信、電腦、信息技術、數據處理及儲存、客戶滿意度分析、支付、印刷、贖回或其
他服務予我們,以使我們能夠經營我們業務,會計師、審計師、IT服務和平台供應商、保險中介機構、再保險承保人、投資經理、代理、
退休金受託人(和其他持分者)、計劃顧問、介紹人、核准的第三方金融和保險產品供應商以及我們的法律顧問。
營銷合作夥伴指我們的服務供應商提供行政、電信、電腦、支付、印刷、第三方獎賞/會員/優惠計劃、醫療/健康/保健相關產品、
贖回或其他服務,以使我們能夠經營我們業務、保險中介、退休金受託人(和其他持分者)、計劃顧問、介紹人和核准的第三方金融
和保險產品供應商。

I/We agree that Parts 4 to 6 herein will constitute part of my/our Application Form for Change of Life Assured and that failure to disclose my
material fact known to me/us or any misrepresentation may void the insurance contract.
本人/吾等同意,此第四至第六部分將構成本人/吾等更換受保人申請書的一部份,亦同意如未能披露任何本人/吾等既知的重要事實,
或作出任何不實陳述,可導致保險合約無效。
Part 7 % LABS Declaration by the Policyowner/Current Life Assured/New Life Assured/ Collateral Assignee (if applicable)
保單持有人/現有受保人/新受保人/抵押承讓人(如適用)聲明
I / We, the policyowner/ current life assured/ new life assured/ collateral assignee, hereby make this application to change the life assured of the policy
according to the above particulars. We understand and agree that this application form will become a part of the policy once approved by Prudential. We
acknowledge and confirm that we fully understand the implication of making this application and have consented to this request.
本人/吾等,作為保單持有人/現有受保人/新受保人/抵押承讓人,在此要求按照上述細則更換保單受保人。我們明白及同意經保誠
批准後此申請表將構成保單之一部份。我們承認及確認我們完全明白本申請之含義及同意這要求。
Part 8 第八部分 Declaration by the Policyowner 保單持有人聲明
Declaration of Policyowner - for Juvenile Policy (Proposed new Life Assured under Age 18 when applying for Change of Life Assured)
I, the Policyowner, declare and consent to act as the trustee of the policy for the proposed assurance subject to the following terms and conditions: (1) all
benefits payable under the policy for the proposed assurance shall belong to the Proposed new Life Assured who shall be the irrevocable beneficiary and
shall be paid through me until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life Assured; (2) I shall have the right to exercise every
option, benefit and privilege under the policy in my capacity as the trustee until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life
Assured; (3) upon the Proposed new Life Assured attaining age 18, I and the Proposed new Life Assured may jointly apply for transfer of the ownership of
the policy to that Life Assured by completing the required forms and providing all information and such documents as Prudential may require at the time of
such application; and (4) upon the transfer of policy ownership to the Life Assured pursuant to clause (3) above, all my rights, entitlements and powers in
relation to the policy shall automatically cease.
適用於兒童保單(即更換受保人申請時擬定之新受保人未滿18歲)-保單持有人聲明
本人,作為保單持有人,現聲明及同意依據下列條款及條件擔任本保單的信託人:(1)本保單之所有保障利益將屬於擬定之新受保人,
擬定之新受保人為本保單之不可撤銷受益人,而所有本保單之保障利益將由本人代擬定之新受保人託管,直至本保單之持有權轉予擬
定之新受保人;(2)本人可以信託人身分行使本保單之任何選擇權、利益及特權,直至本保單之持有權轉予擬定之新受保人;(3)當擬
定之新受保人年滿18歲後,本人/吾等及擬定之新受保人可共同申請將保單持有權轉予該受保人,並填妥所需表格及提供貴公司在申請
時所需之所有資料及文件;及(4)當保單持有權根據上述第(3)條轉予該受保人後,本人於本保單之所有權利、權益及權力將自動終止。

Part 8 第八部分 Declaration by the Policyowner 保單持有人聲明
Declaration of Policyowner - for Juvenile Policy (Proposed new Life Assured under Age 18 when applying for Change of Life Assured)
I, the Policyowner, declare and consent to act as the trustee of the policy for the proposed assurance subject to the following terms and conditions: (1) all
benefits payable under the policy for the proposed assurance shall belong to the Proposed new Life Assured who shall be the irrevocable beneficiary and
shall be paid through me until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life Assured; (2) I shall have the right to exercise every
option, benefit and privilege under the policy in my capacity as the trustee until the ownership of the policy has been transferred to the Proposed new Life
Assured; (3) upon the Proposed new Life Assured attaining age 18, I and the Proposed new Life Assured may jointly apply for transfer of the ownership of
the policy to that Life Assured by completing the required forms and providing all information and such documents as Prudential may require at the time of
such application; and (4) upon the transfer of policy ownership to the Life Assured pursuant to clause (3) above, all my rights, entitlements and powers in
relation to the policy shall automatically cease.
適用於兒童保單(即更換受保人申請時擬定之新受保人未滿18歲)-保單持有人聲明

定之新受保人年滿18歲後,本人/吾等及擬定之新受保人可共同申請將保單持有權轉予該受保人,並填妥所需表格及提供貴公司在申請

results.title_name_en: Employees’ Compensation Insurance (ECI)– Wageroll Reporting (Effective 1 January 2019)
results.title_name_tc: 僱員補償保險的申報工資指引（適用由二零一九年一月一日起生效的新保單及續保保單）
results.content_en:
n)
➢
➢
Employee information (e.g. number of employees, part time / full time,
permanent / temporary work, work location, occupation / position, actual
earnings, requirement to work or take business trips outside of Hong Kong, etc.)
Past claims records
➢
Wageroll records (including MPF contributions records in the previous 12 months
/ relevant tax returns / accounting records)
4.
If I have questions, who should I talk to?
For enquiries, please contact your insurance intermediaries or insurers.
12Industry
5.
The current mechanism of wageroll declaration has been in operation for many
years. Why is it necessary to make a change now?
There has been no changes on the reporting requirement of employees'
information. Under the Employees Compensation Ordinance, employers are
obliged to take out ECI policies for its employees. When doing so, they must
observe the policy terms and conditions and report the actual number of
employees and earnings amount. The Standardized Practice only serves to
reinforce such requirements, which will reflect the actual risks borne by insurers,
thus ensuring employers and employees are protected accordingly.
6.
If employers are uncooperative and refuse to provide the relevant documents,
what should insurance intermediaries do?
Insurance intermediaries should explain to employers that customers are liable
for submitting the relevant documents to insurers for policy application. They
should also remind the employers to act in utmost good faith in the course of the
application process and provide the insurers with true and accurate information.
If employers commented that such documents were not required in the past,
intermediaries should make it clear that the Standardized Practice is now
applicable to the entire insurance industry. That is, the employers are required
to provide the same information regardless of whether they buy the ECI from
insurance agents or brokers.
7.
Would an insurance intermediary be considered breaching the conduct
requirement if he / she fails to take all reasonable steps to obtain the necessary
information / documents from the employers?
Under the prevailing requirements, insurance intermediaries are required to
conduct business in good faith and with integrity at all times. It is also the
insurance intermediaries' obligation to explain to employers that customers are
held responsible for the information provided to the insurer. If the employer
provides the insurer with false information, this may leave the employer open to
legal action by the insurer for recovery of monies previously paid by the insurer
to indemnify any claim under the policy. If an intermediary instigates an
employer to submit false information or fails to do his best in reminding the
employer to submit the required information, he may be breaching the relevant
conduct requirements.
13

results.title_name_tc: 交銀信託提供之保單信託服務
results.content_en:
st application with Bank of Communications Trustee (thereafter
shortened as "BOCT")
b) Obtain confirmation with BOCT by issuing Trust Deeds, usually around 3 -4
weeks.
c) Agents will be notified by BOCT and should prepare the policy change form,
i.e. Beneficiary Appointment Form with Policyowner's signature to
Prudential accordingly, pending attachments as specified in item 3 below. The
workflow shall follow the existing practice as set forth by Life Administration.
Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)d) The required documents (see item 3 below) will be submitted by BOCT to Life
Administration and the Company reserves the right to call for additional
documents for incomplete cases.
e) Upon completion, Company will issue confirmation notices to the Policyowner
(with cc copy to agent).
f) Future correspondence will be sent to original Policyowner subsequent to the
confirmation as usual (as there is no change in policy ownership).
2. Minimum Requirement for setting up policy trust with BOCT
- By Sum Insured: Not less than HK$3 Million (including policy issued with
Prudential and other companies)
- By Assets: Not less than HK$3 Million (including cash value of policy and other
tangibles assets and properties)
- Discretion will be exercised by Bank of Communication Trustee if the above
amount is not met.
- Applying the usual practice of excluding US citizens from the purchase of
investment linked plan, the same restriction will be applied to the discretionary
beneficiaries as set out in the Trust, plus the exclusion for Japanese citizens for all
plans.
3. Documents required for submission to Life Administration
(in accordance with the best practice laid down in the guidance notes of OCI)
- Trust Deed containing Settlor name and beneficiaries name in full
- Relationship declaration of the beneficiaries as contained in the Trust Application
Form or any other supplementary sheet
- Nationality of the Settlor and the beneficiaries (US citizenship will be excluded
for linked policies, Japanese citizenship for all policies, see item 2 above)
4. Responsibilities
4.1 Agent's role
- Agent shall act a referrer and should play no active role in the trust application.
Agents are strongly advised not to give advice on the type of trust and the
consequence, and shall from time to time, refer the client to consult sales staff
from BOCT or their own lawyer if in doubt.
- Agent has NO obligation to sign as witness during the trust application.
- Agent can decide on his own whether to join the sales meeting with the service
provider or not.
- Agent has NO commission from Bank of Communication Trustee in any
Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)

results.content_en:
o sales hotlines (29058726 / 29058730) are specially made available by
BOCT for Prudential's agents. Agents can call the sales hotlines for
appointment booking, case preliminary assessment, technical support and
general enquiry. After the sale meeting, BOCT will collect the following
information and documents if the client decides to proceed with establishment
of a policy trust:
a. Copies of Settlor and Beneficiaries' Identification Documents (e.g. HKID
or passport)
Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)b. Address Proof (e.g. utility bill or bank statement)
c. Copy of Insurance Policy (not compulsory to be provided at the sales
meeting)
d. Correspondence
Address and Contact Information
Beneficiaries)
(Settlor and
e. Trust Name (e.g. The Chan Tai Man Family Trust)
4.4 Customers' role (Know Your Customer issue and disclosure)
- Customers need to observe the disclosure rule regarding the requirement as set out
in item 3 above.
- Customers need to disclose for the purpose of ongoing monitoring, see item 5.
5. Ongoing Monitoring
According to the guidance notes of OCI, the Company has the responsibility to
monitor changes of beneficiary after the setting up of trust including:
- Change of citizenship from i) non US to US and ii) non Japanese to Japanese
nationality for the Settlor and named beneficiaries during the life of policy.
- Change of beneficiaries including relationship change during the life of policy.
Note:
BOCT will be responsible for reporting to Prudential from time to time (using
disclaimer during their sales process and provide training with BOCT's supporting
staff). In case of non-reporting of the change of non US to US citizen for beneficiary
due to negligence, both BOCT and Prudential will be liable to legal suit by the US
government on tax issue.
Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)

Version: Dec 12, 2007 (Final)circumstances.
- Agent has the obligation to follow the said guidelines when using the Company
introduced service provider, BOCT.
4.2 Company's Role
The Company is responsible for overseeing the development and launching of
trustee service to agency. Up to launch, BOCT is NOT the sole service provider
and agents/clients are free to use their own service provider on needs basis. Here
is a summary of key responsibilities:
-
Discuss terms with service provider including the signing up of data protection
letter by BOCT.
- Provide training to agents and ensure they are qualified for providing the added
value service before launching.
- The Company is also responsible for setting up a standard workflow including the
document requirement as set out in this workflow.
- Review performance with BOCT.
4.3 Trustee Company's role
- BOCT will provide marketing support tools including Sales leaflet, brochure with
the background of the Trustee Co., the services (including Will Writing) etc.
- Upon referral through the sales hotline, the service provider will arrange sales
interview with the client direct. (unless notified otherwise)
- The service provider will provide training materials to the Company upon request.
- The service provider will obtain consent from client in each and every trustee
application regarding disclosure of trust information to Prudential.
- The service provider undertakes to observe the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance
and the use of confidential data by signing a letter with Prudential. BOCT promise
not to cross sell using Prudential's client data base.
4.3.1 Sales Process and documents required by BOCT
Two sales hotlines (29058726 / 29058730) are specially made available by
BOCT for Prudential's agents. Agents can call the sales hotlines for
appointment booking, case preliminary assessment, technical support and
general enquiry. After the sale meeting, BOCT will collect the following
information and documents if the client decides to proceed with establishment
of a policy trust:
a. Copies of Settlor and Beneficiaries' Identification Documents (e.g. HKID
or passport)

housewife and insurance agent to align with the occupation classification principle of class 2.

3. Commission Adjustment
Considering product competitiveness and to soothe the impact of premium increment, the commission
rate will be reduced from 37.5% to 30%. Nonetheless, the influence on commission amount is managed
to minimal level as far as possible - premium increment should largely offset the impact from the
commission rate reduction.
Illustrative example: PRUChoice Personal Accident Insurance (Class 1; - Original Sum Insured Amount of
ADPD: HK$500,000 and AME: HK$15,000)

Review the client discount at renewal
We understand some financial consultants may have allowed client discount to customers in the past. We
will send emails to remind financial consultants to review client discount in response to the commission
adjustment before we print renewal documents to those customers whose policies are due to renew on or
after 2 Sep 2023. Financial consultants shall reply to indicate any change of discount intended for the
renewal policies. (A default discount rate, which is the last year's discount or 30%, whichever is the lower,
will be applied if we do not receive any response within the specified time frame), and customers will
receive renewal documents with the updated discount rate.

Part 3 第三部分 Personal Information Collection Statement 收集個人資料聲明
Prudential Hong Kong Limited (Macau Branch) (referred to as "Company", "our", "we", or "us") takes the privacy and protection of your personal information
seriously. We collect personal information from you that is necessary or helpful for us to either provide you with the product or service you have requested or to
comply with statutory or contractual requirements (including the purposes mentioned below), or even for security purpose. We may collect personal information
including, but not limited to, full name, address, contact details, contact details history, date of birth, gender, nationality, family members, beneficiaries, identity
card copy and details, travel document information, health/medical records, credit information, product history, claims history, biometric data including but
not limited to your voice pattern, fingerprint and facial images, your location information based on your device, financial and medical information ("Personal
Information") to provide you with the insurance or financial products or services. "Personal information" shall also include, but not be limited to, the personal
information relating to your beneficiaries (or any other person designated or entitled to receive any benefits under an insurance policy), dependents, authorised
representatives, company staff, and other individuals in relation to which you have provided personal information. If you provide personal information about
another person to us, you confirm that you are either their parent or guardian or you have obtained that person's consent to provide such personal information
for use and transfer by the Company for the purposes set out in this PICS. We may also collect Personal Information about you from third parties such as other
insurance companies, agents, credit reference/reporting agencies, vendors, financial institutions, fraud prevention agencies, government agencies, medical
personnel, courts or public record.
China Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
The PIPL Addendum supplements the Personal Information Collection Statement and applies to you if you are located in Mainland China. The PIPL Addendum is
available on our website at https://www.prudential.com.hk/en/china-personal-information-protection-law .
1. Purpose of Collection
We may use your Personal Information for the following purposes: (a) the administration of our products and services, including to provide any relevant services
as discussed with you prior to any purchase of a product or service; (b) to process your application; (c) to administer and process insurance policies, insurance
claims, medical, security and underwriting checks; (d) to process payment instructions; (e) to verify your eligibility for insurance, financial or wealth management
products and services; (f) to design and provide you with insurance, financial and related products and services; (g) to communicate with you; (h) to comply with
any regulatory or other legal requirements or other internal business requirements (whether imposed on us or any third parties in Section 2 below), including but
not limited to anti-money laundering and Know-Your-Client obligations; (i) to investigate and settle claims and detect and prevent fraud (whether or not relating
to the policy issued in respect of this application) and/or other illegal activity, or security or technical issues; (j) to carry out checks using agencies including credit
reference agencies, tracing companies or publicly available information; (k) to provide customer services; (I) to perform automated decision-making or profiling; (m)
to perform a policy review or needs analysis; (n) to conduct research and statistical analysis (including use of new technologies); (o) to administer lucky draws and
other contests; (p) to enable us to perform our obligations to you; (q) to keep your information on record and carry out other internal business administration;
(r) with your specific consent where required for direct marketing as explained in Section 3 below, personalise and tailor, customised promotions, messages and
suggestions to you; and (s) any other purpose directly relating to any of the above purposes. With your consent, we may also use your personal data to send you
marketing communications, as described in Section 3 below.
Some of the purposes above are necessary to allow us to perform our contractual obligations to you and to enable us to comply with applicable laws and
regulation. We may also use and share your Personal Information for the purposes described above to improve our products and services. Your Personal
Information will be stored either for as long as you (or your joint policyholder) are our customer, or longer if required by law or as is otherwise necessary.
LAPA/PRMMBD (06/24)
